document.title: FY24 Agricultural and Envrionmental Systems Career Field Content Standards

53BCCA2F26BA4D1A99F1AF89ACED905C.description: Describe the diﬀerence between a quantitative and qualitative gene trait and give examples of each.

5A703EF234BF4DF8B1A27A84261B5141.description: Describe how vectors (e.g., plasmids, transposons, viruses) are used to transform hosts and microorganisms.

64C227754CCF4D489D74F37775A4AF1B.description: Define genetically modified organisms and explain their impact on society.

5BC4F103823A44E782C3043232872E01.description: Describe artificial selection and how it is used in plant and animal breeding.

8D623124B0E2443784B1C45581A83E7B.description: Describe genome sequencing and the information gained from it.

94645BFD50CD4607AD39FD8962526684.description: Describe molecular behavior and structure of large molecules, including carbohydrates, lipids, proteins, and nucleic acids.

3BFBD0C2D3314C3189F0D4854F3E8D0F.description: Describe types and features of passive and active transport systems.

394E994028004EC7B384F280060B1372.description: Transform bacteria with exogenous DNA to alter bacterial metabolism, reproduction, cell structures, and their functions.

832BBDCE662B401392FDD65ECE6ABF53.description: Perform genotyping analysis for genetic diagnostics.

C646C7DD338C411699D43662B7C93B5B.description: Evaluate genomes in relation to food, plants, animals, and natural resources.

B60EDB555E72427E949FF9A1DDF0B13B.description: Preform spectroscopy of biological materials explaining the principles behind the procedures, the purpose of a blank, and determine the concentration of biomolecular samples.

692E579C59EA4C2BBC834F1B8B42E891.description: Explain cloning techniques including vector preparation, transformation, and selection.

1CFDF85F4CC84427923D8E9019F2F53B.description: Use bioinformatics to analyze DNA and proteins.

63C3549AC1C44F47BAE07D3F43F3468F.description: Analyze DNA using common laboratory techniques (e.g. DNA isolation, gel electrophoresis, restriction enzyme digest, Southern Blotting, Northern Blotting).

75D969EF998749A6B55C671EF80263C2.description: Identify, isolate, and manipulate peptides and proteins (i.e. primary, secondary, tertiary, quaternary structures).

3260C2BCD795480BA711FD56C9FC9946.description: Explain gene editing including the process, possible benefits, and potential risks.

E3C09B2774814E8F88604CB370D66F3C.description: Describe post-transcriptional and post-translational modification of RNA and describe its function.

A5FBB89509934D7CB2DE498BF781E5BA.description: Model central dogma of molecular biology (e.g. replication, transcription, translation).

CA803D7D7C3647F2B714587456CC0F4D.description: Model, predict, and diagram the three-dimensional shape, types of bonds (covalent and hydrogen bonds), and antiparallel nature of DNA.

ACE4D552F79E4FC5A63FFF3E8F4466DD.description: Explain epigenetics and provide examples of its eﬀects.

F70F6AB5424C4D4EAC19029D0C2D07D8.description: Use Punnett Square to predict and explain Mendel's Laws, genotype, and phenotype.

800D3A95BC234472B8476E0580389901.description: Molecular-Genetics and Technology: Apply knowledge of genetic inheritance and modification to organisms and use genetic information and bioinformatics to analyze specimens.

F53EF23886E84FFC9C771C638879887D.description: Apply quality assurance control processes within the lab setting (e.g. pre-analytic, analytic, and post-analytic sources of error).

B38DFB019C5E4D67B105CF16A47EF5CD.description: Identify the purpose and implementation of bioassays for pathogens.

39D979E3E88E4B1989BE56C0EB52FBF6.description: Perform biochemical assays of proteins, lipids, carbohydrates, nucleic acids, and enzymes.

1F83846AA2FE4807855F2A3F370C97BA.description: Follow complex instructions in performing an assay and explain the role of each step.

31374204937342418C47D5FFD761A208.description: Describe types of assays and distinguish uses and limitations.

610EC1D3AC064C08BCCB93B1EB554750.description: Describe the purpose of an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) and interpret the results.

9AF30D496E504429BAF09855EED73740.description: Identify factors that aﬀect and optimize rates of enzyme assay reactions.

F7623D0FC91B4DCEBBC487F5E81AB139.description: Identify bacteriologic methods necessary for the isolation and identification of organisms.

803F8C35B5DC4682BE446CE15A129F8C.description: Explain how chemical energy operates major cell processes (e.g. biosynthesis, movement, transport, growth).

E4A11E6B97C34B3DA250EE2A8311322D.description: Explain virulence, pathogenicity, and the factors that contribute to pathogenicity.

4AB68D3A3251463E9CFA2E5B91CA1F8D.description: Identify aerobic bacteria through morphological, physical, and biochemical properties.

777DE70F3B9A40ED981FCEB2331F271E.description: Compare and contrast cellular structure and functions of prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells.

A9458964CD7A434C8C7D0E6012D4EF98.description: Use microbial taxonomy and classification systems to identify microbial organisms.

7B2AE90471FE41AC8CAE3021BD2412EA.description: Prepare, incubate, and identify colonies microscopically and macroscopically (e.g., colonial morphology, staining procedures, biochemical analysis).

7CE6AE17CDE845B99186BDA46A37E28E.description: Perform Gram staining to identify morphology and gram results of bacteria.

67C721C4D3074C0396E8E2DACCC8B8DB.description: Explain the principles of microscopy and process a specimen for light microscopy.

6E892AE63D0F423286B96D0EB09092B5.description: Operate centrifuge, dissecting scope, compound microscope, spectrophotometer, incubator, colony counter, pipettes, and other basic microbiology and analytical equipment to examine biological specimens.

66E91551051A40B6AB11F9581F5152DF.description: Explain classification, composition, and preparation of culture media and prepare media for propagation.

52A5C512D3554BFC842E98089161F130.description: Microbiology Testing and Technology: Classify, diﬀerentiate between, and test for various kinds of microorganisms and microbial by- products.

570B4AC5440340B1A6821105CF32E408.description: Calculate the volume, temperature, and pressure of gases using the ideal gas law, Charles's Law, and Boyle's Law.

094D718F34384F84B91165870A057D75.description: Convert units of measure from English to metric, within the English system, and within the metric system.

2D7CC8A440D44410A12A2DD4BB3C37C4.description: Apply standard rules for determining the number of significant figures in measurements and in the answers to corresponding calculations.

D7519434C0834212BB0C7AB052A80078.description: Calculate errors in various measurements, based on data acquired using common laboratory equipment.

D2638514E40242548B27A2867EE33278.description: Use naming systems, including common and International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) conventions.

D7C050B9EFD94B539CE0D5C6201237CD.description: Predict endothermic and exothermic characteristics of chemical reactions.

B15793A746FD4966AA244CE40F6E6CD4.description: Identify materials that can be used as a catalyst and describe their role in reactions.

82FCBF1E6D654B36B49C90B9FB5E6559.description: Apply the concepts of stoichiometry and the laws of thermodynamics to chemical reactions.

62C0E74C67AE4C1FB2042DABE77CE1F1.description: Describe chemical bonding, bond types, and the relationships that they have with the physical state of materials.

BA56D215DDCF4B09BD1487D48199AC45.description: Prepare solutions based on molarity, percent weight per volume (w/v) and percent volume per volume (v/v).

7999DC0FEF614285AF14A96271DAD434.description: Write names and formulas for common compounds.

91D38C28859A4BD1800964CC28AF6BD0.description: Use common and chemical nomenclature for organic and inorganic materials.

2E02A6C0ECCA4837BF6730BC888769CE.description: Diﬀerentiate between organic and inorganic compounds.

8A300256A8FF489F8FEC441946D57C96.description: Use the periodic table to describe atomic structure and to characterize molecules based on functional groups.

9545B1C767B749F0A1316347D38D7988.description: Illustrate electron configurations of elements, compounds, and mixtures.

5C17C185783241E197436F47241B388B.description: Applying Chemistry to Laboratory Practices: Using common laboratory equipment, apply general and organic chemistry concepts to examine the structures, functions, binding of molecules, and methodologies for their purity and characterization.

F021A2F57A724C99A9A9BC5FC70C85F7.description: Use volumetric glassware to accurately measure liquids.

E61D539F47B14D758219670613B9780D.description: Use and calibrate precision weighing and measuring techniques (e.g. analytical balance, micropipette), based on the metric system.

C61DCDFA36E9494381EA729A7DEE203C.description: Use and maintain an inventory management system.

28557D5031C64AA88603EA8BF45F7A04.description: Use and maintain a record keeping system for laboratory equipment, chemicals, or products.

4E43B77F876A4E5EABF2E103E2888D5A.description: Adjust, calibrate, and perform systems diagnostics on laboratory equipment.

21E0C3966B56400699C354495DF8EC56.description: Identify required tools and procedures of diﬀerent biosafety levels.

5E9CC84ACDAE4EE0B3555B20D2DC9CEF.description: Select personal protective equipment for various laboratory protocols.

22F75ADABFD04284973507788590E40F.description: Identify and describe the purpose of common laboratory equipment.

EB5F2CAB6CD14809AC11672494874782.description: Sample, monitor, and record the environmental conditions of a facility (e.g. air quality, HEPA, temperature, microbial contaminations).

A76AB88F87C54F799E022EFB4CC4DC3A.description: Neutralize acids, bases, or caustic solutions for handling and disposal.

C3DA331400554C7E860D67758AAE9A1D.description: Safely transfer chemicals from storage containers to equipment used in the laboratory.

BAE62A6A093D4F65963EBC4E434B6FD1.description: Use chemical references to identify hazards associated with handling and storing chemicals.

0824572B8878434FA3F9F30051F45F90.description: Prepare and interpret labels for chemicals, supplies, and equipment.

E0FCE40526BE491C882BE014A1381C05.description: Specimen, Equipment and Chemical Handling: Handle, prepare, transport, store, and dispose of specimens and chemicals. Monitor, record, and maintain the integrity of equipment and instrumentation, environmental conditions of the facility and inventory.

2513CB3E3345422C8FD22DB2087E9B66.description: Describe industry-based and required regulatory quality assurance practices for documentation.

FB39FA4BF6C147E6A9038EE489809BB5.description: Create a standard operating procedure and explain its use.

6B73424187AD424E85157D7235B2E003.description: Perform separation techniques, including chemical separations, chromatography, centrifugation, distillation and filtration, and interpret the results.

3BAEA0DD52F8487583F2C290F78B5526.description: Monitor physical properties of reagents, buﬀers, media, and solutions for conductivity and resistivity, pH, and turbidity, and explain the significance of each.

A6404BDDF1224DC9B82A8121CE6DC503.description: Perform laboratory measures by calculating and preparing a serial dilution, calculating quantities needed to perform a test analysis, and calculating unit conversions and concentrations (graphing results).

D75C40FB2BBD4B29881B2C279B0A4483.description: Select and apply sterilization methods for regents, buﬀers, media, biological samples, and solutions.

7A16677BA0424FACA591287437D39BF8.description: Test and maintain the integrity of stains, regents, chemicals, and mounts.

7F0EDFB93C3C491E8103866D84974BF4.description: Prepare and dispense stock reagents, buﬀers, media, and solutions by calculating concentrations, adjusting factors such as pH, and selecting purification techniques and equipment.

E27EE34A5C6547458BD83E2263E913FE.description: Use aseptic techniques to collect, prepare, and test samples.

E7DD0816DB2340F781B5F49D30E58041.description: Laboratory Standards Operational Procedures: Conduct experiments using proper industry-based protocols, methods, and techniques.

209149A09D4D48DBA8FCCC216732B5A6.description: Identify the purpose of a bioreactor and its use in the agricultural industry.

65C9455AC1FD4F46975C792F989BC68A.description: Describe how biotechnology products are regulated in the United States.

4ED728334824473CA4E075179B81B2B3.description: Describe how biotechnology products are produced and used in the United States.

DF6DF32E6F8940359DC7FD5D6A1F2F43.description: Evaluate experimental failure and use integrity to communicate findings.

60BD47C98EC54851803BC8F332810720.description: Prepare and present findings using scientific reports.

9D4E55E0E03D44DAB25B441E0D2E3C26.description: Draw conclusions based on observations and data analyses, recognizing that experimental results must be open to the scrutiny of others.

32D1F03ACA4345DC903CD13714298DDB.description: Describe the relationships among variables using correlations and draw conclusions.

4A25C8F9DCC24A5CA630DDEF3A40A6D8.description: Use t-test and p-value to determine statistical significance of results.

27C0BD1D46AD41CC8FD7FBA0686B3DA3.description: Define the concepts of confidence intervals and significant figures.

B63F9DF709EE4D279FA8C12343792FC7.description: Compute measures of central tendency to interpret results and draw conclusions.

88397412622A437B872A37948617FCA7.description: Create, interpret, and use tabular and graphical displays and describe the data.

D08EC54D640B4417BDCBA87CFEB8E666.description: Document results of the experiment in a laboratory notebook, including a statement of purpose, experimental design, observations, results, conclusions, and next steps.

D0D1D7800FE94EF3A3F8A0545C9565BF.description: Explain the importance and design of trialing, and the information gained from it.

5E89DE67B8274D368D646C2C9F8534F5.description: Apply sampling methods that appropriately represent the population and implement procedures for systematic data collection.

B317930C3CC14B59AC353AF7C3BE8100.description: Design a research plan, including the significance of the problem, purpose, hypotheses, objectives, appropriate controls, independent variables, dependent variables, methods of study, and a list of materials.

E1025D82C24846DC8D33DC06511163DB.description: Research and Experiments: Use scientific methodology to conduct problem-based studies, develop products, and interpret results.
